gallery.caption: Passive scene, waiting for the user to interact.

metadata.title: Tech
metadata.value: Disguise D3, Matter.js, Node.js, React, Styled Components

paragraphs: Stink Studios and Google partnered up to create a series of demos showcasing how to push the limits of Google Cloud technology. This was an invite-only event for some of the world’s top C-suite executives.

G-Suite is a tangible example of how Google Cloud supports collaboration and efficiency. Illustrated and animated entirely in-house, we imagined a Rube Goldberg-inspired visual story that shows how easily teams can turn a rough idea into an executive pitch. Playing out over 8 synchronised screens, guests got to kick off ideation in the beginning by choosing three topics from a Jamboard, follow the workflow from Docs to Slides to Sheets, and then tap “send” at the end to launch the idea into the world.
entries.title: Google Cloud Interactive Demo

This has been an exciting journey for Simply Chocolate and it’s never ending! The lovely peeps from [Spring/Summer](http://springsummer.dk/) came back home from the annual Awwwards ceremony with a Site of Year for best e-commerce site. Congratulations! We’ve also been published in .net magazine February issue. I talk about some of the challenges I encountered and some of the magic I used to make these chocolate bars so yummy.
After two years of great times and rewarding collaborations in Copenhagen, I moved on to the next exciting chapter of my life in New York and career at [Stink Studios](https://www.stinkstudios.com/).

gallery.caption: Being tempted to open a bar. Ingredients are scrolling indefinitely. Patterns are dynamically generated, following pre-defined layout rules.
Product page. Bar cracks and reveals its inside composition.

paragraphs: Simply Chocolate is based in Copenhagen. Up there it’s too cold to grow cocoa beans. But it´s hot enough to have a love affair with great chocolate.

Simply Chocolate is a refreshing experience and e-commerce site which features bars for chocolate lovers. It’s been designed with taste around one major key interaction: the unwrapping. Take off the wrapping and dive into delicious ingredients. But watch out for the calories!
entries.title: Simply Chocolate

gallery.caption: Carousel navigation. Hover to preview a story. Opening.
Next story transition. Attention to details.

paragraphs: Beoplay introduces Beoplay H4: wireless, over-ear headphones with a focus on pure essentials. The site is a journey into the customers life, told without filters. It features 3 short stories of 3 different characters, offering a snapshot of their lifes. In addition to that, customers who share a photo of their headphones on Instagram with the hashtag #unfiltered will have their photo featured on the site and participate the unfiltered journey.
entries.title: Beoplay Unfiltred H4

gallery.caption: Wave composed of white dots. Attracted by cursor and following the carousel.
Sound emission. Speed and frequency depending on the volume.

paragraphs: Beoplay introduces Beoplay M5, a powerful, wireless and connected speaker. It can play music across multiple rooms when paired with other speakers. It connects spaces. Inspired by the speaker controls, we introduced white dots as key elements to represent the sound when it moves through the air and different spaces. I worked on making these dots move along the experience whether you interact with them, or just look at them...
entries.title: Beoplay M5
For 10 months, I got the chance to work on developing and prototyping what will be the next digital products of [American Express](https://www.americanexpress.com/).
Moved from Paris to Copenhagen and joined the [e-Types](http://www.e-types.com/) digital team for 3 months.
Graduated from interactive design at [Gobelins — l'école de l'image](https://www.gobelins.fr/), Paris.

gallery.caption: Look and feel of the experience. Interaction example.
Installation is built and is being tested.

paragraphs: Mirage is an interactive short film I directed as part of my diploma project at [Gobelins — l'école de l'image](https://www.gobelins.fr/), Paris.

Edouard, like his peers, is an augmented human. He sees the world through a layer of technology called IO who gives him hints and accuracy for making good decisions. He relies on it, a lot. But to what extend? Isn’t he just losing a bit of his humanity? Is there a limit to transhumanism? Can technology take over his own consciousness? Those are the questions the spectator may ask himself.
entries.title: Mirage

paragraphs: Reuters Wider is a news reader. It promotes the content and the actions carried by the Thomson Reuters Foundation on its website [trust.org](http://www.trust.org/).

Mainstream newspapers are failing on to making mobile solutions for the digital natives. Likely, Wider curates, crosses information, digs in and checks sources, compare medias opinions. It does the job people just don't have time to do. It delivers a new issue every week with an adapted editorial content, entertaining and interactive, it invites you to appropriate the subject.
entries.title: Reuters Wider
Started studying at [Gobelins — l'école de l'image](https://www.gobelins.fr/), Paris as interactive designer and joined [Publicis Nurun](http://nu.run/) as apprentice interactive developer.

meta.description: Hello, I'm Sylvain Reucherand, a developer based in Brooklyn – USA.
